markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Building an Ancestry Paragon Character](/Rules.aspx?ID=1337)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 194</row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
When creating an ancestry paragon character, instead of starting with one ancestry feat and gaining another at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th levels, the character starts with two ancestry feats and gains another at every odd level thereafter (3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, and so on) for a total of 11 ancestry feats.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
name: Building an Ancestry Paragon Character
search_markdown:
<additional-info>

Chapter 4: Variant Rules / Feats and Features / Ancestry Paragon
</additional-info>
text: Building an Ancestry Paragon Character Source Gamemastery Guide pg. 194 When creating an ancestry paragon character, instead of starting with one ancestry feat and gaining another at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th levels, the character starts with two ancestry feats and gains another at every odd level thereafter (3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, and so on) for a total of 11 ancestry feats.
